results.content: This course is great at highlighting certain tools and tricks with Bootstrap, CSS, and JS; however, you'd better be coming in with at least some understanding of the three.  There is very little explanation with anything.  That being said, if you're just looking to polish up your Front-End skills and see a coding-workflow in progress, I'd recommend this course.

response.content:
As i clarified in the course promo video and the course plan video that at least you should have the basics of HTML & CSS .. Everybody explains the basics .. you can find that here or outside Udemy .
But nobody explains what to do next or show you how real world websites developed in front of you .. This course gains you real experience that you will find if you get a job in web design company .
good luck .

There is very little explanation with anything. That being said, if you're just looking to polish up your Front-End skills and see a coding-workflow in progress, I'd recommend this course.

results.content:
Positives: Three nice looking websites, learning about different plugins, learning LESS, learning about the tools and general website development process. Learning to work with .psd files was useful even though I didn't have Photoshop. Definitely value for money.


Negatives: sound quality wasn't always the best, felt rushed at times (too much jumping between screens and the instructor didn't always bother to explain css stuff), presentation wasn't the most engaging, Q&A section is a bit empty. Some opinion on vanilla JS vs. plugins would have been nice.
results.content_html:
Positives: Three nice looking websites, learning about different plugins, learning LESS, learning about the tools and general website development process. Learning to work with .psd files was useful even though I didn't have Photoshop. Definitely value for money.

Negatives: sound quality wasn't always the best, felt rushed at times (too much jumping between screens and the instructor didn't always bother to explain css stuff), presentation wasn't the most engaging, Q&A section is a bit empty. Some opinion on vanilla JS vs. plugins would have been nice.

results.content: Great course for absolute beginners, but if you have enough experience with HTML and CSS this course may be too easy

response.content:
Actually the course target is to Move those who have a basic idea of HTML and CSS to an advanced level in building real world responsive websites, as i explained in the promo and in the why this course lecture .
During the course i explained a lot of concepts like :
Adobe Photoshop , Write Clean reusable code, CSS Preprocessors SASS & LESS, bootstrap 4, Deal with different libraries and plugins, advanced animations and effects with CSS3 and jQuery , Debugging plus fixing warnings and errors, optimizing your website speed and performance, run different tests to your websites, Deliver a full working responsive website, Project Management tool Trello and a lot more ..
so i'm not sure without all of these topics explained how will this course be too easy for beginners?
anyways that's your personal opinion .
